header.article_title: Incredible! Student manages to watch entire Game of Thrones series during Chemistry Lectures
header.author: Author
header.tags: Student | Chemistry | HBO | Game of Thrones | Lecture | College | Freshman

body.p: BOSTON, MA-- At Northeastern University, we found a first-year student that managed to watch the entire series of the popular HBO Series 'Game of Thrones' entirely while he was attending his chemistry lectures. Jason Peters, the freshman engineer states, "You know everyone kept raving about how good Game of Thrones was that I figured I would give it a whirl. I was hooked almost instantly." This incredible feat of determination and perseverance was no easy task, as our experts calculated that he needed to be watching the show a whopping 93% of the hours he was in class. A classmate says, "I don't even know why he shows up. I have actually never seen him looking up from his computer. So much wasted tuition money." Once Peters was completely caught up in the show, he promptly shut his laptop and exited the classroom, completely oblivious to the professor at the front of the classroom. The professor paused for a moment, puzzled as he didn't recognize Peters whatsoever, but quickly returned to the lecture. As he was leaving, we asked Peters why he was so disinterested in chemistry, and couldn't watch the show during his free time, and he replied, "That was chemistry?"
